title: A dealer purchased a washing machine for Rs. 7660. After allowing a discount of 12% on its marked price, he still gains 10%. What is the marked price of the washing machine? - Quora

response.answer_text: Friends….! A dealer purchased a washing machine for Rs. 7660. The Cost Price of washing machine is ₹7660 After allowing a discount of 12% on its marked price, he still gains 10%. What is the marked price of the washing machine? He gas to gain 10% therefore his marked price of washing machine should be 10% of 7660 = 0.10 × 7660 = ₹766 After adding gain 10% the price must be = ₹7660 + ₹766 = ₹8426 He marks the prices such a way that after 12% discount he still get 10% gain. It means that he has to nark the price 12% over the price with 20% gain Let the marked price be ₹100 so after 12% discount the price will be 100 - 12 = ₹88 When sale price is ₹88 than marked price is ₹100 When sale price is ₹8426 then marked price 100/88 × 8426 = 842600/88 = ₹9575 Thus the dealer has to mark the price of washing machine as ₹ 9575 so that after allowing a discount of 12% on its marked price, he still gains 10%. Answer the dealer has to mark the price of washing machine as ₹9575 so that after allowing a discount of 12% on its marked price, he still gains 10%.

Suppose Maked Price is ₹ 100. After giving 12% discount the Selling Price will be ₹88. Gain=10% Then the Cost Price will be ₹80. Now when the CP is ₹80 then the MP is ₹ 100 Then if the CP is ₹ 1 then the MP will be 100/80 Then if CP is ₹ 7660 then the MP will be (100×7660)/80=₹ 9575 Hence the MP will be ₹9575
